website_summaries.verdict: Choose it if you like the idea of the shoulder sling design. Otherwise, consider other models we reviewed.
pros: Sports a unique sling design for easy camera access while carrying it on your shoulder
Lightweight and waterproof, and has a patented all-weather cover
cons: While some owners like the sling design, others find it awkward to carry, especially when quick access to the camera isn't necessary

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Your Equipment Safe
customer_reviews.text: YES! Finally, I found an all purpose case that can take my Nikon D850 and 3 of my favorite lenses on hikes without worrying about damage. This is a big case and I do have a smaller version plus one for surveillance and one very large back pack for extended camping trips. But this case just has everything a photographer needs for quick hikes or smaller specialty shoots.
customer_reviews.author: Bogie

customer_reviews.title: Great camera case
customer_reviews.text: I had an older slingshot camera case very similar to this one and loved it. The zippers finally got bad. The case lasted 18 yrs. Even though this current bag is not made anymore also in lowepros lineup ( too bad ), I was able to find this one.
customer_reviews.author: Gary A.

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I purchased this camera bad. I am able to fit 2 Canon camera bodies with battery grip just perfect. Attached to one camera is a 70-200 lense. In one of the compartment I have my 24-70 lenses. In the other I have my Peak Design lenses holder. Last but not least on the zipper compartment on top of the bag I haven't 100-400 lense. This bag is just perfect for a what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC..
customer_reviews.text: FANTASTIC .....It is large for a sling bag however I tried multiple other bags to fit my camera with 70-200 f2.8 lense attached AND the ability to quickly and easily store and retrieve it....It is EXACTLY why I was needing and I can't praise lowepro quality enough ( not my first or only lowepro sling).....It alos fits all my other carry lenses plus plenty of realestate left over for other gear ( cleaning,batteries, tulip hoods, tripod etc).....Love this bag )
customer_reviews.author: collin fTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: This is a great bag! I can fit all my stuff in ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bag! I can fit all my stuff in a Lowepro Trekker, but brother it weighs a ton. So I bought one of these as one I could use for things like street photography or the like. More than enough room for my Nikon 810 with a 24-120 on it, and I can put a 16-35, 50mm, and a 70-200 f4 in it. Toss a flash in the top, and that pretty handles most any thing. Leave the waist belt on...it makes a difference in comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg Smith

customer_reviews.title: Huge space and versatility for the money
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Value Size Comfort Versatility Quality Cons: Needs more specialized pockets and compartments Needs a removable lens cleaning cloth This bag offers huge value for the money. The Slingshot 303AW is a roomy bag that works for my needs. It fits two bodies with lenses as well as 3 additional lenses. It fits all of my regular gear. I carry a Nikon DSLR with a 35mm DX lens attached as well as a a 35mm SLR with a 55-200 zoom attached. The bag also fits my 55-300, 50mm and 18-55mm lenses. The bag also stows chargers, batteries and two speedlights. Definitely a great bag for daily use. Even though it carries a significant amount of weight, it works well.
customer_reviews.author: S. Winkler

customer_reviews.title: Everything I had hoped for and more.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to carry on a snowmobile trip, both on the back of the sled, and on my back. The interior is well padded, adjustable, and holds an even half dozen of my favorite lenses, plus camera, and an electronic flash. The sling around function works well, and camera is easily removed. Accessing lenses is more of a chore, but I can't see how they might have made it easier. I carry a light meter, and other filters and accessories in the top portion. All in all, the bag is more than I expected, and having had a prior contact with Lowepro on a warranty concern on another item, I would recommend the bag, and the company highly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: More Room than Expected
customer_reviews.text: After going on the cheap and realizing my mistake I went back to the name I trust. This bag will hold a full height SLR or DSLR with battery, grip, or winder attached with most long lenses attached and have plenty of room for a second body or an array of lenses. I was skeptical of a sling bag but I am not anymore. Construction and design is superior to cheap off brands. Gear is padded on every side. And it has a rain fly. What more could you want?
customer_reviews.author: Tim G.

customer_reviews.title: Sweet bag!!
customer_reviews.text: Great bag, I upgraded to this larger size Lowepro of the same bag. I love that I can fit 2 lenses and 3 year for different flashes in the bag along with My rig wearing a battery extender and a telephoto lens. This bag is pretty large really about the size of a backpack but it functions very well I take it on about 90% of my photo shoots when I don't want to tote along a large heavy Pelican case full of gear.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Pitts

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Been on the prowl for a bag that could accommodate my bodies and lenses, and all the things that go with them. I saw the Lowepro Slingshot 302 AW at a great price here, and took the plunge. I tried it out at home with a D-70 body, my lenses, and and gear, and then used it on a trip to local bird sanctuary with my wife and grandkids yesterday. It performed exactly as I had hoped. If I have one quibble, it's with the monopod/tripod clip attachment. The pods will slip out of the small 'bag', but that can be solved by using an alternative setup. Still worth the money I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: John V. Seward

customer_reviews.title: Holds all my gear!
customer_reviews.text: It is my 2nd slingshot. I bought the 1st one 2nd hand and had it for 8 years. I am even happier with the quality in the newer one. It's got a few extra tiny pockets that I am finding very functional. I can keep 1 7d with 70-200 F4 lens attached, plus a Rebel body with battery grip attached, plus 580 EXII, plus 18-150, plus 85 f1.8. Plenty of room for my many needs.
customer_reviews.author: TSC Awareness

customer_reviews.title: I realky like this bag.....
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a bag that wasn't too big that I could put my Nikon DSLR and 3 lenses and other equipment including a flash in without feeling like I was going to bust the bag and this is that bag. The interior is somewhat adjustable so if I need to downsize or use it for something else I can. So far, very durable and user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Would be great backpack, but uncomfortable sling
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this camera bag. It nicely fit my Nikon D3s and everything I'd want to take with it. However, it was extremely uncomfortable on my 5'4" female frame. The main strap was very awkward for me, and the more I adjusted it to fit me, the less it worked as a sling. If this were a regular backpack I would have kept it, but as a sling I just couldn't wear it and had to return it. I will say that my tall boyfriend tried it and really liked it, so I'm sure it's comfortable for some, but I recommend trying before buying especially for women.
customer_reviews.author: Redwood Cat

customer_reviews.title: Great bag; a little big
customer_reviews.text: Great bag. Very well made. This model is a little too big, but I'm keeping it anyway. It does hold all my lenses, etc. I might suggest you look at the same bag but different model number; the one that is a little smaller than this one. Depends on what you need to carry; just realize this is a fairly good sized 'backpack'.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: This is Top of the Line
customer_reviews.text: Don't leave home without these, The wife and I have these and find them to be an excellent product for photographers. It will carry equipment and extras needed for a day of shooting. If the weather goes to pot the rain hood (we have used) is a wounder full equipment saving feature. Equipment used: Canon 5D Mk2 W/battery grip and Canon EF 70-200mm f/2.8L Lens Canon EF 16-35mm Canon EF 85mm Speedlight 430EX2 Dual Battery charger Remote timer 4 CF cards 2 extra LP-E6 Battery's Air rocket and all sorts of other stuff
customer_reviews.author: SharpSeaz

customer_reviews.title: All in one bag!
customer_reviews.text: Yep...it all fit. DSLR Camera, 2 lenses, Sun sniper strap, 2 batteries, charger, filters and so on. I still have some pockets that are not currently occupied by anything. Guess I need to do some more accessorizing! I like the single sling backpack. You can actually leave this slinged on your back, slide the whole bag around front and safely navigate through the bag to get whatever you need. Also got a really good price through AMAZON. It was at least $50.00 less expensive than at BxxtBxxy. Definitely a handy bag!
customer_reviews.author: Lyle Nye Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Big enough for 2 cameras, 4 lenses and extra gear.
customer_reviews.text: The 302 is BIG !!! Weighs 3 pounds empty. I needed a camera bag to carry two dslr cameras and 4 lenses, plus other camera gadgets like external flash etc. Everything fits. It seems large and bulky, but not a lot of alternatives for a sling camera bag to hold as much gear as I'm packing. Very well made, the sling idea works great. I still will use a light sling bag when I carry only one camera just because of the size of this behemoth.
customer_reviews.author: HBK

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect BUT if you notice in their product pics they ...
customer_reviews.text: Lowepro SlingShot 302 AW perfect BUT if you notice in their product pics they don't have lens hoods on...that's because the lenses won't fit otherwise...small primes are fine but wide lenses like 17 to 40 with hood won't fit...with that being said still a great bag...I out the lens hoods in the top pouch our turn then upside down...BUT only if you don't have other lenses beside it...strap it's nice, feels really secure...great BUT not perfect..
customer_reviews.author: Rez jr

customer_reviews.title: Nice for a 5D Mark III with grip and an attached 70-200mm F2.8
customer_reviews.text: But I use my 24-70 more and it can be a hassle. Would prefer it had some cut out for the 70-200 in a user accessible pouch. There is no perfect bag for anyone, but this is farther from perfect than I expected. The top pouch is not shaped to be very useful. Sling is awkward too. Too much weight and a backpack would be better. If you have heavier gear, this is not likely the best choice in a bag. Not a fan of it. Still prefer my Crumpler 8 Million dollar home though it is not water proof.
customer_reviews.author: SithTracy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fit for my new lens
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this back to fit my 250 mm lens and my recently purchased "Sigma 120-400mm f/4.5-5.6 AF APO DG OS HSM Telephoto Zoom Lens". The bag is light, small enough to carry while hiking and yet provides more than sufficient protection for my camera, two lenses and my IPAD mini. I am a big guy and was somewhat concerned about the waist strap being big enough for me. No problem, the straps adjust to fit a big guy like myself.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Mena

customer_reviews.title: Lowepro SlingShot 302 AW camera bag
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Lowepro SligShot to accommodate my new 70-300mm VRII Nikon Zoom lens, I have a 50mm prime lens and a 18-200mm VRII zoom lens, this bag is larger than I need, but just want to make sure the bag has enough room for more lenses in the future. Lowepro is really a quality brand, cost a bit more then most of other brands, Lowepro is better constructed than my other sling bag, and just as good quality as my two Tamerac back pack. Need to mention that the shipping was fast.
customer_reviews.author: G. Wong

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera bag
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera bag! I got into photography last year and this bag has saved my back and makes me look professional. It's comfortable and easily adjustable. It has enough room for my telephoto lens and all my other accessories including tripod. I like being able to just grab my bag and know everything that I might need is in there.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Christian

customer_reviews.title: HAPPY WITH LOWEPRO SLINGSHOT 302
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THE LOWEPRO SLINGSHOT 302. I HAD THOUGHT I MIGHT TRY THE SMALLER ONE, BUT AFTER CAREFUL THOUGHT I CHOSE THIS MODEL AND I AM HAPPY I DID. IT'S GREAT FOR CARRYING MOST OF THE LENS AND CAMERA I USE. EASY ON THE SHOULDERS TOO. THIS REPLACES A BACKPACK I HAVE BEEN USING. I HAVE USED THE BACKPACK FOR HIKING, BUT THE SLINGSHOT IS MUCH EASIER TO GET TO WHEN YOU NEED TO. HAPPY WITH THE PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Solid Bag
customer_reviews.text: It's a good bag made in a quality way. Unless I want to pay for a custom-designed, custom-made bag--and I don't-- I'll likely not find perfection -- and then only until some piece of gear changed. For somebody, for whom this bag is accidentally perfect, it would rate five stars.
customer_reviews.author: DOS

customer_reviews.title: Great on the run bag
customer_reviews.text: This type of bag has been my favorite for years. You throw it over your should and the strap goes across your chest. It balances the weight so your back is safer. Then you swing the pack around to your belly to get your camera out of the bag. I can put a full sized speed light, my Nikon D4, and there is still room for two lenses or a lens and other accessories. This is my go to bag.
customer_reviews.author: Tenna Merchent

customer_reviews.title: it fit my needs better both good
customer_reviews.text: well made , it is too large for my use this would be more for a professional . I ordered the next size down, it fit my needs better both good quality
customer_reviews.author: JIM

customer_reviews.title: rain cover
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble finding the rain cover thought it was missing but they ingeniously have it hidden in a pouch on the bottom of the bag. Also plenty of room in the bag for my Nikon with the battery grip attached. Well done.
customer_reviews.author: Don C.

customer_reviews.title: Fits better than slingshot 250 but bigger Good bag overall
customer_reviews.text: using for Sony a72 with battery grip. Fits better than slingshot 250 but bigger Good bag overall, but bigger. Holds all my necessary gear for quick day out. Recommend highly but not many left out there.
customer_reviews.author: Carl M. Nechtman

customer_reviews.title: Lots of room
customer_reviews.text: I pack my Canon T3 with my 55-250mm is lens attached, and 2 more lenses, plus my 430 II flash and a 500MM 6.5 Mirror reflex lens, and all my filters, cards, remotes and batteries in this backpack. I also mount my tripod on the side. Better to carry it all together on a shoot. Can't go wrong for the price. This is a huge sling bag. Thanks Lowepro and Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Canon54

customer_reviews.title: Enough room equipment for days
customer_reviews.text: Enough room for a camera and a telephoto lens, plus spaces for extra lenses or a Speedlite. It's super comfortable to carry, I've even taken it hiking. It's perfect for all activities
customer_reviews.author: Jahaziel Magana

customer_reviews.title: I'm very pleased with this - I carry one body and 3 ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this - I carry one body and 3 lenses plus accessories easily. The only improvements would be D ring in a pocket for a keyring and a pocket sized for a water bottle. One pocket also contains a strap to hold a hard drive that was disontinued years ago.
customer_reviews.author: David Weisman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to carry and pockets for everything!
customer_reviews.text: This probably isn't your first bag and it won't be your last. But this is a great bag to have in your stable. It has enough room for my biggest lens mounted on my camera, plus plenty of compartments for my other lenses and accessories. You don't always want a bag this big, but it the utility provided often makes it worthwhile. It's very comfortable to carry, too.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Abraham

customer_reviews.title: I love this bag!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is absolutely amazing! It carries everything I need and more...and that's a lot. I like to be prepared, so I take multiple lens. It fits great on an airplane, and allowed for 2 cameras (Nikon D3300 and a Nikon D800) as well as 5 lenses and other things needed.
customer_reviews.author: Eric W.

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for on the go shooting
customer_reviews.text: It's super easy to get to your photo gear - this is its greatest feature- carry everything but get to your camera in a moment's notice. and this fit more gear than their urban series. Good bag, well built, comfortable. Even with a sling you can use the waist strap to rebalance for longer treks, so it works like a backpack too. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Ayers

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: This bag has lots of room and does exactly what its advertised to do. It has so many cool features like a sewn in microfiber lens cloth, weather cover, and tripod carrier. The bag is put together well and made sturdy. My only gripe is that the waist belt was detachable. I imagine if I a few heavy tele lenses I would use it but as it goes right now I have no need for it and would like to remove it.
customer_reviews.author: Donald W. Ritchey

customer_reviews.title: Great bag. Fits all the necessary lenses and a ...
customer_reviews.text: Great bag. Fits all the necessary lenses and a flash with a Mark III with battery grip no problem. I just wish it had some side pockets for some extra storage for batteries, cleaning stuff, off camera flash transmitter/receiver, and a water bottle holder would be a great add on one side.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Prime Member

customer_reviews.title: A great bag. Easy to get on and off
customer_reviews.text: A great bag. Easy to get on and off. Comfortable. Great storage capacity. Easy to get my camera out and take a picture on the go (potential buyers should watch the video of the 302 slingshot bad on Lowepro's website).
customer_reviews.author: J. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Love the bag and how much it can hold
customer_reviews.text: Love the bag and how much it can hold. You cannot have enough bags. I tend to pack everything in this bag to take the equipment somewhere but then take out what items I want and choose smaller bags as needed. One can never have enough different size bags
customer_reviews.author: S. Green

customer_reviews.title: ... a camera and smaller items but what I really like is that it expands so my 70/300 lens can ...
customer_reviews.text: This bag is cute and just right for a camera and smaller items but what I really like is that it expands so my 70/300 lens can fit along with the camera attached.
customer_reviews.author: John Gaspard

customer_reviews.title: then this would be a great purchase. However
customer_reviews.text: The bag is a beast but I guess that's where it's both a strength and a weakness. I had no problem fitting whatever I wanted into my bag as an amateur photographer with about 3-4 lenses in hand. However, I often find this to be uncomfortable with long travel days. My preference these days is to travel lighter with 1 or 2 lenses. If you intend on using this bag for everything, then this would be a great purchase. However, if you prefer light travel, stick with the smaller sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Y

customer_reviews.title: Really nice camera bag.  Many storage compartments.  NO disappointment!
customer_reviews.text: Very large bag that will hold camera, numerous lenses, gadgets, etc. Very sturdy with moveable compartment partitions. Tie-ons on the outside for tripods or whatever. It has a protective cover where the camera is stored and a wet-weather cover that is stored in the bottom of the case. This is totally accessible from the outside. So far, no complaints. I can even use the extra separate compartment for the things I carry in my purse. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Olson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Nikon
customer_reviews.text: I have had this bag for some time and it has been perfect for my camera requirements. Holds all my camera lens and accessories and keep them organized and protected. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: John Powers

customer_reviews.title: Very nice sling/backpack for DSLR gear - I switched to a ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice sling/backpack for DSLR gear - I switched to a satchel later, but used the Lowepro sling for awhile happily.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I have the 202 Slinshot but wanted more room for addition lenses. This one fits the bill.
customer_reviews.author: RogerEH

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. For my needs
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. For my needs, it has less useful room than a slightly smaller older bag I have, because of the two compartments. So I sent it back. Nothing wrong, just didn't suite my needs.
customer_reviews.author: rohithg

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't ask for more!
customer_reviews.text: What a bag! I've used it for months, it never fell short, holds everything I need for a remote shoot in the mountains: two lenses in cases, DSLR, batteries and chargers, lunch, 160-LED light kit, mono-pod on the side, memory cards, cleaning cloths, with plenty of room left. What a well constructed case. Highly recommended value for the money. Don't go bigger, don't go smaller, this is the best I have used.
customer_reviews.author: ballinthejack

customer_reviews.title: A+++
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag as it will carry camera safely ...rain cover is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Reed

customer_reviews.title: my first really nice camera bag
customer_reviews.text: the snapchick ( look for her online ) recommended this bag a while back but i didn't have a budget for 150 dollars amazon is awesome when your wish list articles drop price they let you know and it dropped to 75 dollars ( a steal ) came in quick it is such an awesome bag everything and more than i thought it would have
customer_reviews.author: rheuma9

customer_reviews.title: Well made with great Lowepro quality
customer_reviews.text: This really should be a backpack rather than a sling, it's just too big to be a decent sling pack in my opinion. Well made with great Lowepro quality, as expected, but the bulkiness does not translate to useful storage space or comfortable wear.
customer_reviews.author: OdylicMaven

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made I have hauled it around for 7 months now! Lots of storage and the quality of the zippers and latches are great! I feel confident carrying my equipment around in it!!
customer_reviews.author: fotog

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. My only negative is I wish the tripod ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. My only negative is I wish the tripod "holder" was a little bigger. When walking with the tripod on the side it makes it very easy to hit someone with and fall out.
customer_reviews.author: b16integra

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera bag
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera bag, but be sure to measure you gear carefully to see if this will suit your needs. It's a lot smaller than I thought it would be so I ended up returning it. Typical Lowepro quality, though, meaning it's built very well.
customer_reviews.author: SaoirseMT

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy for Field Photographers or owners who want to store large cameras with telephoto lens mounted
customer_reviews.text: Best bag for large DSLR's or Film Cameras with long lens attached. The bag has plenty of storage for additional lenses and accessories. The sling strap is handy in the field for quick lens changes. Bag is sturdy build quality, but lite enough for a field trip.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Kellond

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: This product is very well made. It's stitched well and is a very high quality product. The shoulder strap is well padded and the waist strap is long enough to go around a big guy. The compartments are well padded and water resistant to keep sensitive equipment from being damaged. I definitely would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. BynackTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design
customer_reviews.text: The bag is well thought out and so it is easy to understand why it has been so popular for the past 5 years. The current pricing makes it a very good value and the Lowepro durability and interworkability with the other Lowepro accessories utilizing the Slip-Lock tabs makes my addiction to Lowepro hard to overcome.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk J. Pinto

customer_reviews.title: Never leave your gear at home again!
customer_reviews.text: Love this case. Fits all of my camera gear. It is very heavy when filled, but that is by choice. Unless you have very large lenses, you won't be on a shoot without the right lens, filter, flash, etc. again. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MerryAnn

customer_reviews.title: Better Than My Old Backpack
customer_reviews.text: I found it a lot easier to "sling" the pack around and grab my camera than to have to take off my old backpack I had, open it up then put it back on. Plenty of space for whatever you need to carry around with you. A good buy for me!
customer_reviews.author: S. Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Great camera bag, and gear protector.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Holds all my gear safely and very spacious. Fits comfortably, I wear it all the time. I' ve had it for almost a year and no issues. Built tough to last.
customer_reviews.author: TP284

customer_reviews.title: Needs more protection for the camera and changeable shoulder strap
customer_reviews.text: A really great bag. Two things I'm not crazy about (hence the 3 star review) is that you can't change what side the strap is placed so you can only put it over your right shoulder. There should also be some kind of padding to protect the camera a bit more. I had to put another pad from a different camera bag in to hold the lens down so the camera doesn't bounce around. Other than that, a great bag.
customer_reviews.author: Brian S.

customer_reviews.title: The best and the only camera bag I use
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Lowepro Slingshot bags for 10 or so years, The best and the only camera bag I use.
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: good bag but there are some drawbacks! inconvenient to carry on the back!
customer_reviews.author: paata

customer_reviews.title: Great sling...
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag. So comfortable on your back. Lots of room... It's so easy to get your camera out when still on your shoulder... 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: Linda S. Holt

customer_reviews.title: Lowepro SlingShot 302 AW
customer_reviews.text: I love finally having the ability to take multiple lenses with me and still have room to grow. This is a great carrying case. My only issue, is that being at a height of 5'2" tall, I feel a little taken over by the size of this 'backpack'. Regardless, I like it, it's extremely convenient and being able to turn it around to access a lens without taking the whole thing off is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Iceisnice

customer_reviews.title: Love the Sling Pack
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love the pack, Comfortable to hike with, Very easy to slip around and access everything - very well laid out and made. Been buying Lowepro since college 40 years ago and still use the original bags :)
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Donald Gay

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera bag for over 5 years. It's tough, water resistant, and it has lots of storage.
customer_reviews.author: 3Gr8KidsDad

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag
customer_reviews.text: Nice bag for all my stuff. Holds my Nikon D5100 with the 55-300 lens attached as well as 6 other lenses. My 500mm mirror lens won't fit in the lens pockets because it is so wide. The newer lenses are more lightweight so the bag is not too heavy. Great Lowepro quality
customer_reviews.author: Senior Swede

customer_reviews.title: she absolutely loved it. Loves that it has a lot of ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for my sister and as a semi-professional photographer, she absolutely loved it. Loves that it has a lot of compartments than she knows what to do with it and loves the cover for when it rains. She'll be using this for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Samra Delnessa

customer_reviews.title: Well made, but seems clunky. It ultimately didn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Well made, but seems clunky. It ultimately didn't fit the gear I wanted to carry (though the bag is quite large, so it might work for you). We sent ours back.
customer_reviews.author: Todd C

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: First I bought the Slingshot 202 AW and just loved it but it was just a tad small for an extended day hike. I returned the 202 and bought the 302 and couldn't be happier. It holds all my camera gear and has room for a water bottle, first aid kit, etc. Amazon is great about returns - they make it so easy.
customer_reviews.author: jd11

customer_reviews.title: A bit big, but still great
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge fan of LowePro gear. I've had LowePro bags for years now. This bag will carry my very large camera and many of my lenses for day hikes and exploration. Big enough for my 150-500mm lens and my additional lenses too.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M. Staples

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: I love the fit of the slingshot and the compartments. I dislike that my camera (Canon t2i) sometimes moves around a bit more than I'd like. I'm sure I could remedy this by adjusting the velco walls some but as currenty constructed the main camera area is a bit big for me. The construction of the bag however is great. It's easily accessibly, it's just a matter of remembering where I put everything because there is so much room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was nice but could not accommodate all my equipment.
customer_reviews.author: sandman

customer_reviews.title: Works with Canon 5Dmark II with Sigma 70-200 f/2.8 IS
customer_reviews.text: I love these bags. I also have the 202 but needed the 302 with the addition of my new Sigma 70-200 f/2.8 with IS .. Snug fit but works
customer_reviews.author: row_b_show

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera bag
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera bag. I needed more space , my other Lowepro 101 got too small and this fit the bill. It was a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: not a geek

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and much better zippers then the others. Nice straps.
customer_reviews.author: Marcster

customer_reviews.title: Carries all my camera accessories
customer_reviews.text: This bag was an upgrade to my Lowepro 200AW that did not fit my 300mm zoom lens without cramming it in. This bag has a lot more room and holds my Canon 60D plus 5 lens and quite a few accessories.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Marvelous Camera Bag!
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a bag for all my stuff! Previously, I was carrying items separately because they couldn't all fit in the smaller bag I was using. This bag is very comfortable too. Very glad I bought this!
customer_reviews.author: T. Kay

customer_reviews.title: Finally
customer_reviews.text: Finally got a deal on it. I had a 102 before and loved it. Gave it to my in law and get this one. It is big for sure. But same high quality as 102.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel de Sharpshooter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera bag.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camera bag. Bigger than I thought it would be, but you end up needing the space. Love the one strap design and waist strap for long walks.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great equip carrier I already owned the 202 & needed ...
customer_reviews.text: Great equip carrier I already owned the 202 & needed bigger. I already liked the 202 & knew lowepro construction. I wanted to continue with this type of bag only bigger.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: more than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a bag to hold my camcorder (the Sony NEX-VG10). I was a bit nervous that it wouldn't fit but I have discovered that it has the room and more for anything I could need in using this camera. The bag is great, a bit larger than expected but still that is nothing to be concerned about. The rain gear is amazing and much needed in my area. The more I use this product the more I like it. It is simple and does everything needed with a little extra. If you need a DSLR or small camcorder bag, and you plan on being on the move a bit it is the perfect bag to take.
customer_reviews.author: emulous

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied a shopping experience, product quality is very good, very satisfied with the speed of logistics
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied a shopping experience, product quality is very good, very satisfied with the speed of logistics
customer_reviews.author: guo wei

customer_reviews.title: I wish it had 2 shoulder straps instead of the single
customer_reviews.text: I wish it had 2 shoulder straps instead of the single. Otherwise it works fine and I can carry lots of extra lens, flashes, and extra gear when I'm on a photo shoot.
customer_reviews.author: LD in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, just to big somedays.
customer_reviews.text: The bag is great. It fits my Sony A57 with the Tamron 70-200 mm f/2.8 lens attached, but with the hood turned backwards. It holds everything I own, camera, 4 lenses, and a flash. The only problem is sometimes I wish I had a small bag too for daily trips.
customer_reviews.author: Poppa J

customer_reviews.title: This is a beautiful bag! Well built and very roomy
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful bag! Well built and very roomy. Once I received it though, I realized it was too much for my needs, so I returned it and got something different.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hulse

customer_reviews.title: not comfy
customer_reviews.text: i bought this for among other things, the sling strap....it's not comfortable for me, unless you use the waist strap...other than that, it's well built
customer_reviews.author: doug1408

customer_reviews.title: Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: this bag holds everything and more. I now have a problem putting unnecessary stuff in it and it gets too heavy. Very sturdy and extremely functional for a DSLR bag.
customer_reviews.author: Funman

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Bag
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for on the go photography. Has a spot for 4-5 lenses and all the accessories need for on the go. Swing the bag around to the front gives easy access to the camera without taking off the bag. Construction looks good. The bag should last a long time. Course only time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Howell

customer_reviews.title: love it, no more putting my bag down the ...
customer_reviews.text: love it , no more putting my bag down the dirt and taking two minutes to get my gear out to shoot!!!!! this bag makes it almost instant
customer_reviews.author: Brian Alves

customer_reviews.title: Just what the doctor ordered..
customer_reviews.text: Love this pack! Plenty of room for my 60D and at least 4 lenses including a 70-200. If I shuffle a few things around I might have room for another camera!
customer_reviews.author: tuffsheet

customer_reviews.title: excellent. - 2 bodies (d-600 and d-90 with grips)
customer_reviews.text: one word : excellent.- 2 bodies (d-600 and d-90 with grips),3 lenses, 3 flashes and more...I love it.-
customer_reviews.author: Edison Leis Techera

customer_reviews.title: " Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas present for my husband, who had researched them extensively before requesting this one. He said it is "perfect for my needs." Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph B.

customer_reviews.title: Everything but the kitchen sink!
customer_reviews.text: The perfect way to safely carry all your essential camera gear. Safe way to access the gear without taking the backpack completely off. Lotz of compartments. Comes in all colors, if you like black.
customer_reviews.author: McCaptain

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my D7000 & long zoom lenses
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to accommodate my Nikon d7000 as well as a multitude of lenses including the Tamron 70-300 and Tamron 200-500. Everything fits nice and secure with many extra features.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Best camera bag you could ever buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Lots of room for all lenses and gear, including tripod!! Plenty of pockets for the small stuff and a awesome built-in rain cover!! Cons: None.
customer_reviews.author: SnowCrow

customer_reviews.title: My dad loves this he has two cameras with lens ...
customer_reviews.text: My dad loves this he has two cameras with lens he could stop talking about all the different pockets
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: Very large
customer_reviews.text: Thought the bag was going to be too big, but I actually filled it with all my camera equipment. Great way to carry everything to every game. Easily accessible.
customer_reviews.author: Winterone

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: exactly what I wanted! Sturdy fabric with great padding. Lightweight. Holds everything I need and then some. Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Patti A Rains

customer_reviews.title: Good Capacity, Well-Built but Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a traditional 2-strap backpack, thinking I would like it better, due to not having to take it off to switch lenses, etc. Great capacity; easy to customize. I was able to fit a full frame pro DSLR with , a large zoom lens, 2 other lenses, a flash unit, charger, spot meter and various accessories quite easily. However, I did not like the one-shoulder design. It was uncomfortable and caused a lot of strain on my shoulder and back, and did not make it that much easier to get into the bag. Will be selling on ebay or Craigslist and going back to 2-strap style.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs D

customer_reviews.title: superb bag at a very affordable price!
customer_reviews.text: item shipped fast. i love this bag, it has a lot of compartments and i was able to fit all my lenses and dslr. i love the fact that it was priced fairly well too!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal S.

product_meta.title: Lowepro Slingshot 302 DSLR Sling Camera Bag
product_meta.description:
The Lowepro Slingshot 302 AW: Fast access. Extra space for personal items. Enhanced organization. Plus, space for a tripod. The original camera sling bag design allows for quick rotation from back to front to access gear. The increased volume throughout the design provides additional space for personal items and accessories. Easy-glide zippers offer smooth operation and fast access to all compartments. The camera compartment features a padded and adjustable divider system. The built-in memory card pockets on the inside lid provide quick access to spare memory. The Hideaway Tripod Mount system secures a compact tripod or monopod to the side of the sling. The patented built-in All Weather AW Cover protects gear from the elements. The SlipLock attachment loops expand the carrying capacity. The Slingshot 302 AW fits a Pro DSLR with attached zoom lens (up to 70-200mm f/2.8), 4-6 extra lenses or flashes and accessories, a compact tripod or monopod and personal items. Pro DSLR camera models that fit the Slingshot 302 AW include: Canon EOS 1d Mk IV, Canon EOS 5D/5Ds/5Dsr, Canon EOS 7D, Canon EOS 70D, Nikon D4/D4s, Nikon D600/D620/D800/D800e/D810, Nikon D7000/D7100/D7200, and Sony Alpha DSLR-A99/A900.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


 Description: 
The new, fast-access SlingShot AW series builds on the inventive design of the original and incorporates what many photographers are looking for: faster access, extra space for personal items, improved organization, and the ability to add a tripod. The SlingShot AW offers more volume in the upper compartment for extra accessories or personal items. A Hideaway Tripod Mount system with foldout holder and quick-release buckle secures a compact tripod to the side. The same inventive design—letting you quickly rotate to the front to access—remains a Sling Bags tried-and-true feature of this customer favorite. Also includes: a patented All Weather AW Cover; 3 SlipLock attachment loops; built-in microfiber cleaning cloth; and more. 

 Hardware Capacity: 
Pro DSLR with attached zoom lens (up to 70-200mm f/2.8); 4-6 additional lenses or flash units and accessories (including a point-and-shoot camera); compact tripod or monopod; personal items 


SlingShot 302 AW:

 1. Original camera sling bag design 
Allows quick rotation from back to front to access camera, lenses and accessories without removing bag 

 2. Increased volume throughout the sling 
Provides additional space for personal items and accessories in an upper compartment, stash pocket and front pocket 

 3. Easy-glide zippers 
Offer smooth operation and fast access to all compartments 

 4. Main camera compartment with updated divider system 
Accommodates most popular DSLR models 

 5. Hideaway Tripod Mount system 
Secures a compact tripod or monopod to side of sling via a foldout holder, quick-release buckle and strap 

 6. Ergonomic sling strap 
Offers a unique, comfortable way to carry gear 

 7. SlipLock attachment loops 
Expand carrying capacity by adding compatible pouches, cases and bags 

 8. Two built-in memory card pockets 
Provides easy-to-access extra memory on inside lid of main compartment 

 9. Adjustable padded waistbelt 

 10. Repositioned, built-in microfiber cloth 
Provides convenient cleaning cloth that tucks into a mesh pocket and out of the way of camera 



 Additional Features & Benefits: 

 * All weather AW cover protects camera gear and personal items from the elements and tucks away when not in use



 Airline carry-on compatible
feature_bullets: Fits a Pro DSLR with attached zoom lens (up to 70-200mm f/2.8), 4-6 extra lenses or flashes and accessories, a compact tripod or monopod and personal items. Pro DSLR camera models that fit the Slingshot 302 AW include: Canon EOS 1d Mk IV, Canon EOS 5D/5Ds/5Dsr, Canon EOS 7D, Canon EOS 70D, Nikon D4/D4s, Nikon D600/D620/D800/D800e/D810, Nikon D7000/D7100/D7200, and Sony Alpha DSLR-A99/A900
